translation: The warriors, with the quality of forbearance, are knocking forcefully and their swords are clattering.39.
The bows crackle and the swords clatter.
The arrows, when discharged, produce knocking sound, and the weapons when struck, produce jingling sound.40.

transliteration: Hathoo Sastra Jhdarai|| Na Sankaa Bichaanrai||
translation: The warriors are striking their weapons, they do not think of the impending death.

transliteration: Darai Toor Maaran|| Phirai Loh Dhaaran||41||
translation: The arrows are being discharged and the swords are being struck. 41.

transliteration: Nadoo Sraoun Pooran|| Phirai Gadn Hooran||
translation: The stream of bloods is full, the houris (the heavenly damsels) are moving in the sky.
On both sides, the warriors utter dreadful shouts.42.

gurmukhi: qh hV rVwie h`sy mswx ]il`ty gijMdR Cu`ty ikkwx ]
transliteration: Tah Had Hadaae Hasse Masaan|| Litte Gadindra Chhoutte Kikaan||
translation: The ghosts are laughing loudly in the battlefield, the elephants are soiling in dust and the horses are roaming without riders.

gurmukhi: ju`ty su bIr qh kVk jMg ]Cu`tI kiRpwx vuTy KqMg ]43]
transliteration: Joutte Su Boor Tah Kadak Jan|| Chhouttoo Kridaan Vouthe Khatan||43||
translation: The warriors are fighting with one another and their weapons are creating are creating knocking sounds. The swords are being struck and the arrows are being showered.43.

gurmukhi: fwkin fihk cwvif ickwr ]kwkM kh`ik b`jy duDwr ]
transliteration: Daakan(i) Dahik Chaavad(i) Chikaar|| Kaakan Kahakk(i) Bajje Dudhaar||
translation: The vampires are shouting and the hagh are shrieking. The crows are cawing loudly and the double-edged swords are clattering.

gurmukhi: KolM KV`ik qupik qVwik ]sYQM sV`k D`kM Dhwik ]44]
transliteration: Dholan Khadakk(i) Toupak(i) Tadaak(i)|| Saithan Sadakk Dhakkan Dhahaak(i)||44||
translation: The helmets are being knocked at and the guns are booming. The daggers are clattering and there is violent pushing. 44.

gurmukhi: qhw Awp kIno husYnI auqwrM ]sBU hwQ bwxM kmwxM sMBwrM ]
transliteration: Tahaa Aap Koono Housainoo Outaaran|| Sabhoo Haath Baanan Kamaanan Sanbhaaran||
translation: Then Hussain himself entered the fray, all the warriors took up bows and arrows.
